summary: The Tennessee Valley Authority Salary Transparency Act amends the Tennessee Valley Authority Act of 1933. It mandates the TVA to publicly report the names, salaries, and duties of its management-level employees earning above a certain pay grade. This information is exempted from disclosure under specific federal laws. The bill also updates several references within the original act, primarily related to financial reporting and auditing procedures, including updating references to the Government Accountability Office. A conforming amendment to Section 14 is also included.
